timeseries_services module¶

model_evaluation_utils.py¶

The module containing APIs for computing metrics to evaluate model

Copyright 2020 - The IoTwins Project Consortium, Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna. All rights reserved.

src.utils.model_evaluation_utils.assign_class_rising_anomaly(rising_anomaly_predicted_probabilities, lb_threshold, ub_threshold)¶

model_evaluation_utils.assign_class_rising_anomaly::Assign classes to predicted results, thresholding probabilities generated by categorical_crossentropy loss function Positive class assigned to values between lower bound threshold (lb_threshold) and upper bound threshold (ub_threshold)

Parameters

  • rising_anomaly_predicted_probabilities – numpy array the predicted results, that is the probability of having a rising edge

  • lb_threshold – float lower bound threshold

  • ub_threshold – float upper bound threshold

Returns

numpy array predictions as classes (0.0 or 1.0 values)

src.utils.model_evaluation_utils.compute_best_threhsold(real_y, predicted_y, receptive_field, start, stop, num_steps, strategy='linear', growth_mode='same')¶

model_evaluation_utils.compute_best_threhsold::Compute best threshold for the given predictions (predicted_y) according to real class values (real_y), choosing between threshold bounds from ‘start’ to ‘stop’ computed according to the given strategy.

Parameters

  • real_y – numpy array true labels (ground truth)

  • predicted_y – numpy array predicted labels

  • receptive_field – integer number of temporal steps considered in the analysis

  • start – float lower bound probability threshold

  • stop – float upper bound probability threshold

  • num_steps – int number of steps

  • strategy – string chosen strategy

  • growth_mode – string chosen growth mode

Returns

list list of threshold values closer to the lower bound

Returns

list list of threshold values closer to the upper bound

src.utils.model_evaluation_utils.compute_metrics(tn, fp, fn, tp)¶

model_evaluation_utils.compute_metrics::compute and print accuracy metrics

Parameters

  • tn – int true negatives number

  • fp – int false positives number

  • fn – int false negatives number

  • tp – int true positives number

Returns

Python dictionary computed metrics

src.utils.model_evaluation_utils.get_best_score_info(lb_thresholds, ub_thresholds, predicted_y, real_y, metric='f1_score')¶

model_evaluation_utils.get_best_score_info::Compute best score evaluating passed lower bounds and upper bounds threshold values as probability bounds for the given predictions Metrics could be ‘accuracy’, ‘precision’, ‘recall’ and ‘f1_score’.

Parameters

  • lb_thresholds – list list of threshold values closer to the lower bound

  • ub_thresholds – list list of threshold values closer to the upper bound

  • real_y – numpy array true labels (ground truth)

  • predicted_y – numpy array predicted labels

  • metric – string chosen metric

Returns

Python dictionary computed accuracy statistics

src.utils.model_evaluation_utils.get_thresholds_values(start, stop, num_steps, strategy='linear', growth_mode='same')¶

model_evaluation_utils.get_thresholds_values::Split threshold values between start and stop according to the chosen strategy. Growth_mode could be ‘same’, ‘increment_ub’or ‘increment_lb’: I) ‘same’ means taking equal length intervals, II) ‘increment_ub’ means increment upper_bounds and fix lower_bound, III) ‘increment_lb’ means increment lower_bounds and fix upper_bound. The strategy could be ‘linear’ or ‘log’ (base 10)

Parameters

  • start – float lower bound probability threshold

  • stop – float upper bound probability threshold

  • num_steps – int number of steps

  • strategy – string chosen strategy

  • growth_mode – string chosen growth mode

Returns

list list of threshold values closer to the lower bound

Returns

list list of threshold values closer to the upper bound

src.utils.model_evaluation_utils.print_info(info)¶

model_evaluation_utils.print_info::print previously computed accuracy statistics

Parameters

info – Python dictionary computed accuracy statistics

dataset_holes_utils.py¶

The module containing APIs for dealing with holes in the time-series (e.g. missing data)

Copyright 2020 - The IoTwins Project Consortium, Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna. All rights reserved.

src.utils.dataset_holes_utils.fill_hole(prev_ts, foll_ts, dataset)¶

dataset_holes_utils.fill_hole::fills hole in dataframe; holes are filled with values that linearly grows according to previous and following timestamp difference

Parameters

  • prev_ts – datetime previous timestamp

  • foll_ts – datetime following timestamp

  • dataset – Pandas dataframe time-series dataframe

Returns

datetime list list of new timestamps

Returns

Pandas dataframe time-series dataframe with holes filled

Returns

Parameters

full_dataset_sorted – Pandas dataframe time-series dataframe with possible holes (must be sorted by timestamp)

Returns

Pandas dataframe time-series dataframe having <timestamp, is_hole> columns

src.utils.dataset_holes_utils.update_hole_labels(dataset, receptive_field, data_to_ignore_label=2)¶

dataset_holes_utils.update_hole_labels::update labels - label value becomes -1 when observation is less than <receptive field> steps away from an hole

Parameters

  • dataset – Pandas dataframe time-series dataframe

  • receptive_field – int receptive field, number of observations to be considered

  • data_to_ignore_label – int samples with this label value (an integer) must be ignored

Returns

Python list list of modified labels

  • column_name – string columns identifying the timestamps

  • new_column_name – string name of the new column added to the dataframe

  • inplace – boolean determines working with a copy of the original dataframe or the original itself

Returns

Pandas dataframe time-series dataframe with new column with datetimes
